content.title: Dr. Ambedkar Medical Aid Scheme (Revised – 2009)
content.department: Directorate of Welfare of Scheduled Caste & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana
content.beneficiary: Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe persons
content.details: The scheme is meant to provide medical treatment facilities to patients suffering from serious ailments requiring surgery of the Kidney, Heart, Liver, Cancer, and Brain or any other life-threatening diseases including Knee surgery and Spinal surgery to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe persons whose annual family income is less than ₹ 1,00,000/- per annum.
benefits: Medical treatment facilities for serious ailments.
Coverage for surgeries related to Kidney, Heart, Liver, Cancer, Knee, Spinal, and Brain.
eligibility: Applicant must belong to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe Community.
Annual family income must not exceed ₹ 1,00,000/- per annum.
Suffering from major ailments requiring surgery.
documents_required: Original Estimated Cost certificate duly signed by the Medical Superintendent of the concerned hospital.
Original or attested photocopies of the income certificate, caste certificate, and ration card of the patient.
Recommendation from a local sitting Member of Parliament or District Magistrate.
Certificate from the Medical Superintendent regarding total estimated cost of treatment.
Estimated Cost Certificate containing the date fixed for the surgical operation.
An attested photograph of the patient.

faqs.question: What is the scope of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The state government provides medical treatment facilities to patients suffering from serious ailments to Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe persons whose annual family income is less than ₹ 1,00,000/- per annum.

faqs.question: What are the types of medical treatments provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Patients having serious ailments requiring surgery of the Kidney, Heart, Liver, Cancer, Knee, Spinal, and Brain, or any other life-threatening diseases may be provided treatment under this scheme.

faqs.question: How much amount of the treatment will be directly released to the concerned Hospital?
faqs.answer: 75% of the estimated cost of the treatment will be directly released to the concerned Hospital, with a maximum ceiling limit of ₹1,00,000/- in each case.

faqs.question: How much amount of the total admissible medical aid will be paid, in advance to the concerned Hospital?
faqs.answer: 50% of the total admissible medical aid will be paid, in advance, directly to the Hospital before surgery as the first installment.

faqs.question: Is this scheme for all type of patient?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only for the patient of Scheduled Caste and Scheduled Tribe communities.

faqs.question: What should be the family income to avail the benefit of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The annual family income should be less than ₹ 1,00,000/- per annum.

faqs.question: How I can apply for the medical aid?
faqs.answer: The applicant shall apply for medical aid in the prescribed application form, duly certified by the Medical Superintendent of the concerned Hospital.

faqs.question: Can I apply only through offline mode for medical aid?
faqs.answer: Yes, the duly filled-in form should reach the Director, Dr. Ambedkar Foundation, 15, Janpath, New Delhi, at least 15 days before the date of surgery.

faqs.question: Who will process the application?
faqs.answer: All the applications received will be processed by Dr. Ambedkar Foundation.
